central.name: Ayushman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY)
central.department: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
central.description: Health coverage up to Rs.5 lakh per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization.
central.eligibility: Eligible families as per SECC / state lists.
central.howToApply: Check eligibility on the official PM-JAY portal and contact empanelled hospitals.

central.name: Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana
central.department: Ministry of Finance / Department of Posts
central.description: Small deposit scheme for girl child for education and marriage expenses.
central.eligibility: Parents/guardians can open account for a girl child aged below 10 years
central.howToApply: Open account at post office or authorised banks offering the scheme.
documentsRequired: Birth certificate of the girl child

central.name: SMILE (Support for Marginalized Individuals for Livelihood and Enterprise)
central.department: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
central.description: Support for marginalized individuals including transgender persons for livelihood and enterprise.
central.eligibility: Transgender persons and marginalized groups as defined by state/centre guidelines
central.howToApply: Contact State Social Justice Department or visit the national portal.
documentsRequired: Proof of community or self-declaration as per state rules

central.name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN)
central.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare
central.description: Direct income support to small and marginal farmers to supplement their financial needs for procuring inputs and meeting other agricultural requirements.
central.eligibility: Small and marginal landholding farmers as per state/proper land records.
benefits: Direct cash transfer to farmer families
central.howToApply: Registration is through state/UT portals and common service centres; check the PM-KISAN portal for state-level instructions.

central.name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
central.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare
central.description: Crop insurance scheme to provide financial support to farmers suffering crop losses due to natural calamities, pests and diseases.
central.eligibility: All farmers growing notified crops and enrolled in the scheme for the season/year.
benefits: Stability for farm income after disaster
central.howToApply: Enroll through your insurance provider or state agriculture department during the enrolment window.

central.name: National Health Mission (NHM)
central.department: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
central.description: Strengthening healthcare delivery across states, focusing on maternal and child health, nutrition, and primary healthcare services.
central.eligibility: All residents; specific programmes target pregnant women, infants, children, and vulnerable groups.
benefits: Access to maternal and child health services
central.howToApply: Visit the nearest public health centre or check state NHM portals for programme-specific enrolment.
documentsRequired: Aadhaar or local ID for registration where required

central.name: Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY)
central.department: Ministry of Skill Development & Entrepreneurship
central.description: Short-term skill training and certification programme to enable youth to take up industry-relevant jobs.
central.eligibility: Youth meeting age and educational criteria as specified for individual courses.
central.howToApply: Register on the PMKVY portal or visit an authorised training centre.

central.name: Kisan Credit Card (KCC)
central.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare
central.description: Provides farmers with timely access to credit for agricultural needs at reasonable interest rates.
central.eligibility: Farmers with land records or tenant farmers as specified by banks/state rules.
central.howToApply: Apply at participating banks with land record documents and KYC; some states allow online application via agri portals.

central.name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana (PMKSY)
central.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare
central.description: Focused on improving farm productivity and ensuring efficient water use through irrigation and water-saving technologies.
central.eligibility: Farmers and farmer groups participating in irrigation and water conservation interventions.
central.howToApply: Contact the state agriculture department or local irrigation office for scheme-specific enrolment.

central.name: Soil Health Card Scheme
central.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare
central.description: Provides soil testing and soil health cards to farmers with recommendations on fertilizers and soil amendments to improve crop productivity.
central.eligibility: All farmers can avail soil testing services; eligibility for periodic testing as per state programmes.
central.howToApply: Visit the nearest soil testing laboratory or enrol through the state agriculture portal.

central.name: Mid-Day Meal (MDM) Scheme
central.department: Ministry of Education / Department of School Education
central.description: Provides hot cooked meals to children in government and government-aided schools to improve enrolment, retention and nutritional levels.
central.eligibility: All children enrolled in eligible schools under the programme.
central.howToApply: Automatic inclusion through school enrollment; for grievances contact the school authority or district education office.

central.name: Samagra Shiksha
central.department: Ministry of Education
central.description: An integrated scheme for school education extending from pre-school to class 12, focusing on improving quality, access and inclusive education.
central.eligibility: Students enrolled in government and aided schools; specific interventions have eligibility criteria.
central.howToApply: Programmes are delivered through schools and district education offices; contact the local school or education department for details.

central.name: National Scholarship Portal (NSP)
central.department: Ministry of Education
central.description: Centralized portal to apply for various scholarships offered by central and state governments for students at various levels of study.
central.eligibility: Depends on the specific scholarship; generally based on income and academic criteria.
central.howToApply: Register and apply via the National Scholarship Portal (NSP).

central.name: Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY)
central.department: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
central.description: Safe motherhood intervention to promote institutional deliveries among pregnant women, with cash assistance and referral transport.
central.eligibility: Pregnant women meeting the scheme criteria (varies by state and institutional delivery status).
central.howToApply: Register at the health facility at time of delivery or antenatal registration; community health workers assist in enrollment.

central.name: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY)
central.department: Ministry of Women and Child Development
central.description: Maternity benefit programme providing cash incentives to pregnant and lactating women for improved health and nutrition.
central.eligibility: Pregnant women and lactating mothers meeting criteria set by the scheme.
central.howToApply: Register through Anganwadi centre or state welfare portal during pregnancy registration.

central.name: MGNREGA (Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act)
central.department: Ministry of Rural Development
central.description: Provides at least 100 days of guaranteed wage employment in a financial year to rural households to enhance livelihood security.
central.eligibility: Adult members of rural households who volunteer to do unskilled manual work and are registered under MGNREGA.
central.howToApply: Register at the local Gram Panchayat office or apply through the state rural development portal.

central.name: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Gramin (PMAY-G)
central.department: Ministry of Rural Development
central.description: Provides housing assistance to eligible rural households for construction/upgradation of dwelling units with basic amenities.
central.eligibility: Rural households identified as eligible in the Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC) or state lists.
benefits: Convergence with other rural programs for amenities
central.howToApply: Apply through Gram Panchayat/State public portal or contact the rural development department.

central.name: National Food Security Act (NFSA) / Public Distribution System (PDS)
central.department: Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food & Public Distribution
central.description: Provides subsidised food grains to eligible households under the Public Distribution System as per NFSA entitlements.
central.eligibility: Households included in the state's NFSA/PDS list as per eligibility criteria.
benefits: Subsidised food grains (wheat, rice, coarse grains)
Cooking gas subsidies in some linked schemes
central.howToApply: Apply for inclusion through the local ration card office or PDS outlet; check state PDS portal for updates.

central.name: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY)
central.department: Ministry of Finance / Department of Financial Services
central.description: A national mission to ensure access to financial services such as bank accounts, credit, remittances, insurance, and pensions at an affordable cost.
central.eligibility: Any resident without a bank account may open an account with simplified KYC under the scheme.
central.howToApply: Open account at any participating bank branch or camp with simplified KYC (Aadhaar-based).

central.name: Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana - National Rural Livelihood Mission (DAY-NRLM)
central.department: Ministry of Rural Development
central.description: Promotes self-employment and organization of rural poor into Self Help Groups (SHGs) to enable sustainable livelihoods.
central.eligibility: Poor rural households, with priority often given to women and marginalized groups.
central.howToApply: Register with the local Rural Development office or through SHG federations and state rural livelihood missions.

central.name: PM SVANidhi (Support for Urban Street Vendors)
central.department: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
central.description: Micro-credit scheme to provide affordable working capital loan to street vendors to resume livelihoods post-COVID and improve economic resilience.
central.eligibility: Street vendors documented by ULBs or vendor registries; other criteria as defined by the scheme.
central.howToApply: Apply via local urban local body (ULB) portals or designated banks/CSC centres.

central.name: Stand-Up India / PM-SYM
central.department: Ministry of Finance / Department of Financial Services
central.description: Provides bank loans between 10 lakh and 1 crore to at least one SC/ST borrower and at least one woman borrower per bank branch to promote entrepreneurship.
central.eligibility: SC/ST entrepreneurs and women entrepreneurs meeting lending criteria; projects eligible for bank finance.
benefits: Support and handholding through partner institutions
central.howToApply: Apply through partnered banks or the Stand-Up India portal with project details and KYC.

central.name: SMILE - Comprehensive Rehabilitation for Welfare of Transgender Persons (Central Sector sub-scheme)
central.department: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
central.description: Sub-scheme under SMILE focusing on scholarships, skill training, livelihood support and shelter homes (Garima-Grih) for transgender persons at the national level.
central.eligibility: Self-identified transgender persons as per guidelines; specific eligibility varies by component (scholarships, training, shelter).
central.howToApply: Register via the MSJE/SMILE portal or apply through authorised implementing agencies and state social welfare departments.

central.name: Central Scholarships for Transgender Students (SMILE / MSJE)
central.department: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
central.description: Scholarships covering school (class IX) through postgraduate levels to support education of eligible transgender students under MSJE/SMILE schemes and linked portals.
central.eligibility: Transgender students meeting academic and income criteria as per scholarship rules.
benefits: Financial scholarships for tuition and maintenance
central.howToApply: Apply through the national scholarship portal or MSJE/SMILE designated scholarship portals when calls are open.

central.name: Garima-Grih (Shelter Home Support) - SMILE component
central.department: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
central.description: Central funding and support for short-term shelter homes (Garima-Grih) for homeless, abandoned or at-risk transgender persons as part of SMILE's rehabilitation measures.
central.eligibility: Transgender persons who are homeless, abandoned, or in need of temporary shelter and support.
central.howToApply: Referral through district social welfare/NGO partners or approach designated Garima-Grih centres for intake as per state coordination.
documentsRequired: Referral documents from social welfare agencies

central.name: National Legal Services Authority (NALSA) - Free Legal Aid
central.department: Department of Justice / NALSA / State Legal Services Authorities
central.description: NALSA provides a national framework for free legal aid and legal awareness; state and district legal services authorities extend legal services (including to transgender persons) for matters such as identity, discrimination, and access to services.
central.eligibility: Persons eligible under the Legal Services Authorities Act and marginalised groups; transgender persons can access legal aid through SLSAs/DLSAs.
central.howToApply: Approach the State Legal Services Authority (SLSA) or District Legal Services Authority (DLSA) or use NALSA contact channels for access to services.
documentsRequired: Documents relevant to the legal matter

central.name: Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) / Saksham Anganwadi / Mission POSHAN 2.0
central.department: Ministry of Women & Child Development
central.description: Large-scale central programme covering early childhood care and nutrition (Anganwadi services), Saksham Anganwadi modernisation, and Mission POSHAN 2.0 to improve nutrition outcomes and early child development.
central.eligibility: Pregnant women, lactating mothers, and children as per ICDS programme guidelines.
central.howToApply: Register at local Anganwadi centre or contact the Department of WCD/state ICDS authorities.

central.name: One Stop Centre Scheme (Sakhi)
central.department: Ministry of Women & Child Development (Nirbhaya Fund)
central.description: One Stop Centres provide integrated support and assistance to women affected by violence, including medical, legal, psychological and temporary shelter services.
central.eligibility: Women survivors of violence seeking assistance.
central.howToApply: Approach the nearest One Stop Centre or contact the state MWCD helpline; referral through police, health or social welfare agencies is possible.

central.name: Mahila Shakti Kendra (MSK)
central.department: Ministry of Women & Child Development
central.description: Community-level resource centres to empower rural women through information, training, skilling and convergence of existing services.
central.eligibility: Women in rural areas; linkages often through Gram Panchayats and block-level structures.
central.howToApply: Approach local Mahila Shakti Kendra or contact the state WCD/MKD office for enrollment into programmes.

central.name: Mahila e-Haat
central.department: Ministry of Women & Child Development
central.description: An online marketplace to help women entrepreneurs and SHG members sell products and services directly to buyers across the country.
central.eligibility: Women entrepreneurs, SHG members and groups as per platform rules.
central.howToApply: Register on the Mahila e-Haat portal and create a vendor profile to list products.

central.name: Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana (PMMY)
central.department: Ministry of Finance / Department of Financial Services
central.description: Provides loans up to 10 lakh to non-corporate, non-farm small/micro enterprises without collateral under Shishu, Kishor and Tarun categories.
central.eligibility: Micro and small entrepreneurs, including women entrepreneurs and micro-enterprises.
benefits: Support for business setup and growth
central.howToApply: Apply at participating banks or NBFCs with business details and KYC; special outreach camps often held for women and disadvantaged groups.

Andhra Pradesh.name: Amma Vodi (Financial Support to Mothers)
Andhra Pradesh.department: Government of Andhra Pradesh - Department of School Education
Andhra Pradesh.description: Direct cash assistance to mothers/guardians to encourage school attendance and reduce dropouts.
Andhra Pradesh.eligibility: Mother or female guardian of school-going children who meet the state's enrollment criteria.
Andhra Pradesh.howToApply: Beneficiaries are usually identified through school records; contact the District Education Office or visit the state education portal.

Andhra Pradesh.name: YSR Cheyutha
Andhra Pradesh.department: Government of Andhra Pradesh - Department of Women and Child Development / Welfare
Andhra Pradesh.description: Timed cash support and livelihood assistance aimed at women (particularly those from disadvantaged groups) to help start or scale livelihoods and micro-enterprises.
Andhra Pradesh.eligibility: Women in the specified age group and belonging to eligible economic categories as per state guidelines.
benefits: Access to skill training and market linkages
Andhra Pradesh.howToApply: Apply or verify eligibility through the state welfare portal or local anganwadi/district office.

Andhra Pradesh.name: Jagananna Vasathi Deevena (Hostel & Fee Support)
Andhra Pradesh.department: Government of Andhra Pradesh - Department of Education
Andhra Pradesh.description: Financial support and fee reimbursement for students from disadvantaged backgrounds to enable higher education and boarding/hostel support.
Andhra Pradesh.eligibility: Students meeting the income/eligibility criteria defined by the state for higher education support.
Andhra Pradesh.howToApply: Apply through the state education department/fee reimbursement portal or contact college administration for assistance.

Andhra Pradesh.name: YSR Aasara (Pension & Social Security)
Andhra Pradesh.department: Government of Andhra Pradesh - Social Welfare / Pension Division
Andhra Pradesh.description: Pension and social security support for elderly, disabled and widowed women to ensure basic income and care.
Andhra Pradesh.eligibility: Elderly persons, widows, and persons with disabilities as per state pension rules.
Andhra Pradesh.howToApply: Apply at the local Mandal/Tehsil office or through the state social welfare/pension portal.

Andhra Pradesh.name: Andhra Pradesh Transgender Rehabilitation & Livelihood Programme
Andhra Pradesh.department: Government of Andhra Pradesh - Department of Social Welfare
Andhra Pradesh.description: A state programme focused on social rehabilitation, skill training and livelihood support for transgender persons, including micro-enterprise support and linkages to finance.
Andhra Pradesh.eligibility: Self-identified transgender persons who are residents of Andhra Pradesh.
Andhra Pradesh.howToApply: Register with the State Social Welfare Department or through authorised NGOs and training centres listed by the state.
documentsRequired: Self-declaration or identity certificate if available

Andhra Pradesh.name: AP Transgender Health & Counselling Initiative
Andhra Pradesh.department: Government of Andhra Pradesh - Health & Family Welfare
Andhra Pradesh.description: Health screenings, mental health counselling, and referral services for transgender persons at selected state hospitals and health centres.
Andhra Pradesh.eligibility: Transgender residents seeking health and counselling services.
Andhra Pradesh.howToApply: Approach the nearest state-run primary health centre, community health centre or the designated transgender cell at district hospitals.

Andhra Pradesh.name: Jagananna Gorumudda (Nutritional Support / Midday Meals Enhancement)
Andhra Pradesh.department: Government of Andhra Pradesh - Department of School Education / Health & WCD
Andhra Pradesh.description: Enhanced nutrition and midday-meal support for school children to improve health and educational outcomes; benefits families and caregivers.
Andhra Pradesh.eligibility: All enrolled school children in government/assisted schools as per programme rules.
Andhra Pradesh.howToApply: Inclusion is generally automatic through school enrollment; contact the school or district education office for queries.

Andhra Pradesh.name: YSR Rythu Bharosa
Andhra Pradesh.department: Government of Andhra Pradesh - Department of Agriculture
Andhra Pradesh.description: Direct benefit transfer to farmers for support in agricultural activities, fertilizers, and crop maintenance.
Andhra Pradesh.eligibility: Registered farmers of Andhra Pradesh with valid land records.
benefits: Support for inputs and farming operations
Andhra Pradesh.howToApply: Farmers must register through the state agriculture department portal or at Mandal offices; many beneficiaries are auto-enrolled through land records.

Andhra Pradesh.name: AP Crop Insurance Supplement
Andhra Pradesh.department: Government of Andhra Pradesh - Department of Agriculture
Andhra Pradesh.description: State supplement to central crop insurance schemes to ensure adequate compensation for crop losses and faster disbursals.
Andhra Pradesh.eligibility: Farmers enrolled under PMFBY or notified state insurance programmes.
Andhra Pradesh.howToApply: Claims are processed through the state's agriculture insurance cell and patta/land records need to be presented.

Andhra Pradesh.name: AP Maternal & Child Health Initiative
Andhra Pradesh.department: Government of Andhra Pradesh - Health & Family Welfare
Andhra Pradesh.description: State-driven programmes to improve maternal health, reduce infant mortality and provide nutrition and ante/post-natal care.
Andhra Pradesh.eligibility: Pregnant and lactating mothers and infants as per state NHM guidelines.
Andhra Pradesh.howToApply: Register at local public health centres, Anganwadis or via the municipal health office.

Andhra Pradesh.name: AP School Health & Wellness Programme
Andhra Pradesh.department: Government of Andhra Pradesh - Department of School Education / Health
Andhra Pradesh.description: Routine health check-ups, vision/hearing screening and wellness education for school children across the state.
Andhra Pradesh.eligibility: All school students enrolled in state-run and aided schools.
Andhra Pradesh.howToApply: Programmes run through schools; parents may be asked to provide consent and basic IDs when required.

Andhra Pradesh.name: AP Skill Development for Rural Women
Andhra Pradesh.department: Government of Andhra Pradesh - Department of Rural Development / Women & Child Development
Andhra Pradesh.description: Short-term vocational training and entrepreneurship support for rural women to improve employability and income generation.
Andhra Pradesh.eligibility: Rural women aged 18+ residing in Andhra Pradesh; priority to SHG members.
Andhra Pradesh.howToApply: Apply via local Mandal/Block offices, women's SHG federations or the state skill portal.

Arunachal Pradesh.name: Arunachal Pradesh Women & Child Health Initiative
Arunachal Pradesh.department: Health & Family Welfare Department, Arunachal Pradesh
Arunachal Pradesh.description: State programmes aligned with NHM to improve maternal and child health services, ante/post-natal care, and nutrition for pregnant and lactating women.
Arunachal Pradesh.eligibility: Pregnant and lactating women and infants registered with local health centres.
Arunachal Pradesh.howToApply: Register at the nearest Primary Health Centre (PHC) / Anganwadi or district health office.

Arunachal Pradesh.name: Arunachal Pradesh Transgender Health & Livelihood Support
Arunachal Pradesh.department: Social Welfare Department / Health Department, Arunachal Pradesh
Arunachal Pradesh.description: State-supported health screenings, counselling and targeted livelihood training for transgender persons, coordinated with NGOs and district social welfare offices.
Arunachal Pradesh.eligibility: Self-identified transgender residents of Arunachal Pradesh.
Arunachal Pradesh.howToApply: Approach district social welfare office or designated NGO partners; register at PHC for health services.
documentsRequired: Aadhaar or any local ID; self-declaration may be accepted

Arunachal Pradesh.name: Arunachal Farmer Income Support & Extension Services
Arunachal Pradesh.description: State agriculture support focusing on crop diversification, input subsidies, women farmer empowerment, and extension services tailored to hilly and tribal agriculture.
Arunachal Pradesh.eligibility: Farmers resident in Arunachal Pradesh; priority to smallholders and women cultivators.
benefits: Market linkages and minor irrigation support
Arunachal Pradesh.howToApply: Register at block agriculture offices or through the state agriculture portal; attend local extension camps and trainings.
documentsRequired: Land records / tribal land certifications where applicable

Arunachal Pradesh.name: Arunachal Pradesh Women Farmer & SHG Support
Arunachal Pradesh.department: Rural Development / Social Welfare, Arunachal Pradesh
Arunachal Pradesh.description: Formation and strengthening of women Self Help Groups (SHGs), access to microcredit, and agripreneurship training for women in rural and tribal areas.
Arunachal Pradesh.eligibility: Women groups and SHGs in Arunachal Pradesh.
Arunachal Pradesh.howToApply: Contact District Rural Development Agency (DRDA) or state SHG federations for registration and support.

Arunachal Pradesh.name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) - Arunachal Pradesh implementation
Arunachal Pradesh.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare / Arunachal Agriculture
Arunachal Pradesh.description: Central direct income support scheme for farmers implemented via state/UT portals; supports small and marginal farmers including women cultivators in Arunachal Pradesh.
Arunachal Pradesh.eligibility: Farmer families meeting PM-KISAN criteria and registered with the state portal.
benefits: Periodic direct cash transfers to farmer families
Arunachal Pradesh.howToApply: Register through the state agriculture or PM-KISAN portal via block offices or CSC centres.

Arunachal Pradesh.name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) - Arunachal Pradesh
Arunachal Pradesh.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare / State Agriculture
Arunachal Pradesh.description: Central crop insurance scheme providing compensation for crop losses; implemented with state coordination and special arrangements for hilly/tribal cropping systems.
Arunachal Pradesh.eligibility: Farmers growing notified crops and enrolled in PMFBY in the notified season.
Arunachal Pradesh.howToApply: Enroll through state agriculture offices or authorised insurance service points during the enrolment window.

Arunachal Pradesh.name: National Health Mission (NHM) - Arunachal Pradesh
Arunachal Pradesh.department: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare / State NHM
Arunachal Pradesh.description: Central NHM programmes implemented in Arunachal Pradesh including maternal & child health, immunisation, and nutrition interventions at PHCs and through community health workers.
Arunachal Pradesh.eligibility: All residents; targeted services for pregnant women, lactating mothers and children.
Arunachal Pradesh.howToApply: Access services at PHCs, CHCs and Anganwadi centres; contact district health office for specific programmes.
documentsRequired: Aadhaar or local ID where required

Arunachal Pradesh.name: Ayushman Bharat - PM-JAY (Arunachal Pradesh)
Arunachal Pradesh.department: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare / State Health Department
Arunachal Pradesh.description: National health protection scheme offering cashless hospitalisation for eligible families; rolled out in Arunachal Pradesh via empanelled hospitals and state health machinery.
Arunachal Pradesh.eligibility: Families listed under SECC / state beneficiary lists for PM-JAY.
Arunachal Pradesh.howToApply: Check eligibility on the PM-JAY portal or approach empanelled hospitals/state health offices.

Arunachal Pradesh.name: Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) / Mission POSHAN (Arunachal)
Arunachal Pradesh.department: Ministry of Women & Child Development / State WCD
Arunachal Pradesh.description: Anganwadi-based nutrition, early childhood care and supplementary feeding programmes implemented in Arunachal Pradesh under ICDS/Mission POSHAN 2.0.
Arunachal Pradesh.eligibility: Pregnant women, lactating mothers and children enrolled at Anganwadi centres.
Arunachal Pradesh.howToApply: Register at local Anganwadi centre or contact the state WCD office.

Assam.name: Assam Maati - Women Farmer Support
Assam.description: State-level schemes targeting women cultivators for training in sustainable hill/terrace farming, input support and market linkages.
Assam.eligibility: Women farmers and cultivators registered with state agriculture departments or local farmer groups.
Assam.howToApply: Register at block agriculture offices or through the state agriculture portal; attend local Kisan melas and extension camps.
documentsRequired: Land records or local farm registration

Assam.name: Assam Women SHG & Livelihood Programme
Assam.department: State Rural Livelihood Mission / Social Welfare, Assam
Assam.description: Formation and nurture of women SHGs, microfinance linkages, and skill training for value-added agriculture and handicrafts.
Assam.eligibility: Women groups and SHGs registered within Assam's rural livelihood mission.
Assam.howToApply: Contact the District Rural Development Agency (DRDA) or state SRLM office for SHG registration and support.

Assam.name: Assam Farmer Insurance & PMFBY Implementation
Assam.department: Department of Agriculture, Assam / State Insurance Cell
Assam.description: State implementation and special provisions of PMFBY for flood-prone and tea/tribal cropping systems in Assam to support compensation for crop losses.
Assam.eligibility: Farmers growing notified crops and enrolled for the notified season/year.
Assam.howToApply: Enroll at block agriculture offices or insurance registration points during enrolment windows.

Assam.name: Assam Student Scholarships & Girls Education Support
Assam.department: Department of Education / Social Welfare, Assam
Assam.target: Girls and students from disadvantaged backgrounds
Assam.description: State scholarships, fee reimbursement and special incentives to support retention of girls in school and higher education access for rural areas.
Assam.eligibility: Students meeting academic and income/category criteria under state schemes or central scholarship portals.
Assam.howToApply: Apply through college/university portals, state education portal or the National Scholarship Portal (NSP) where applicable.

Assam.name: Assam Transgender Health & Social Support
Assam.description: State programmes for transgender persons focusing on health screenings, counselling, identity support and linkage to livelihood/training opportunities.
Assam.howToApply: Approach District Social Welfare office or designated NGOs for registration and support.
documentsRequired: Aadhaar or any available ID; self-declaration accepted where applicable

Assam.name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) - Assam
Assam.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare / Assam Agriculture
Assam.description: Central direct income support for farmers implemented in Assam to benefit small and marginal farmers including women cultivators registered with the state portal.
Assam.eligibility: Registered farmer families meeting PM-KISAN criteria.
benefits: Periodic direct cash transfers to farmer families
Assam.howToApply: Register via PM-KISAN/state agriculture portal or at CSC centres.

Assam.name: National Health Mission (NHM) - Assam
Assam.department: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare / State NHM
Assam.description: NHM programmes delivered in Assam including maternal & child health, immunisation, Janani Suraksha Yojana support and nutrition interventions through Anganwadis and PHCs.
Assam.eligibility: All residents; targeted services for pregnant women, lactating mothers and children.
Assam.howToApply: Access services at PHCs, CHCs and Anganwadi centres; contact state NHM office for programme details.
documentsRequired: Aadhaar or local ID where required

Assam.name: Ayushman Bharat - PM-JAY (Assam)
Assam.department: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare / Assam Health Department
Assam.description: National health protection scheme implemented in Assam offering cashless hospitalisation to eligible families via empanelled hospitals.
Assam.eligibility: Beneficiaries as per SECC/state lists for PM-JAY.
Assam.howToApply: Check eligibility on PM-JAY portal or approach empanelled hospitals/state health offices.

Assam.name: ICDS / Mission POSHAN (Assam)
Assam.department: Ministry of Women & Child Development / State WCD
Assam.description: Anganwadi-led nutrition and early childhood programmes implemented in Assam to deliver supplementary nutrition, growth monitoring and early education supports.
Assam.eligibility: Pregnant women, lactating mothers and enrolled children at Anganwadi centres.
Assam.howToApply: Register at local Anganwadi centre or state WCD office.

Bihar.name: Mukhyamantri Kanya Utthan Yojana (Bihar)
Bihar.department: Department of Social Welfare & Women and Child Development, Government of Bihar
Bihar.description: Scholarships, stipends and support services for girl students to improve school retention and higher education participation.
Bihar.eligibility: Girls and young women from economically weaker sections and specified vulnerable categories in Bihar as per scheme guidelines.
benefits: Scholarships/stipends for secondary and higher education
Bihar.howToApply: Apply through the State Education Department portal or contact District Education Office; some scholarships use the National Scholarship Portal.

Bihar.name: Mukhyamantri Kanya Suraksha (Bihar Girl Child Protection)
Bihar.department: Department of Social Welfare & Women and Child Development, Government of Bihar
Bihar.description: Health, nutrition and protection interventions for pregnant women, lactating mothers and girl children, aligned with ICDS/NRHM/NHM at the state level.
Bihar.eligibility: Pregnant & lactating women and girl children registered with Anganwadi centres and health facilities in Bihar.
benefits: Institutional delivery support and transport assistance
Bihar.howToApply: Register at local Anganwadi centre or Primary Health Centre (PHC); contact the Block/ District Health Office for programme enrolment.

Bihar.name: Bihar Mahila Kisan Sahayata
Bihar.department: Department of Agriculture, Government of Bihar
Bihar.description: Support program for women farmers including training, input subsidies, women-only farmer groups and linkages to credit and markets.

benefits: Training in climate-smart farming and post-harvest practices
Access to credit and market linkages through FPOs/SHGs

Bihar.name: Bihar Transgender Empowerment & Livelihood Scheme
Bihar.department: Department of Social Welfare, Government of Bihar
Bihar.description: State-level initiatives for social inclusion, skill training, stipend support and entrepreneurship assistance for transgender persons in Bihar.
Bihar.eligibility: Self-identified transgender persons resident in Bihar; registration with district social welfare office may be required.

Bihar.name: Bihar School Health & Nutrition Programme
Bihar.department: Department of Education & Health, Government of Bihar

benefits: Referral to higher care when required
Bihar.howToApply: Services provided through school health programmes under the state education and health departments; contact school authorities or District Education Office.

Bihar.name: ICDS / Anganwadi Services - Bihar
Bihar.department: Department of Women and Child Development, Bihar
Bihar.description: Integrated Child Development Services providing preschool education, supplementary nutrition, health check-ups and counselling for mothers and children.
Bihar.eligibility: Pregnant & lactating mothers, infants and children registered with Anganwadi centres across Bihar.
benefits: Early childhood education and maternal counselling
Bihar.howToApply: Register at the local Anganwadi Centre; contact the state WCD/ICDS cell for scheme-specific details.

Bihar.name: Mahila Shakti Kendra - Bihar
Bihar.department: Ministry of Women & Child Development / Bihar State Implementation
Bihar.description: Community-level centres for empowering women via information, training, skilling, digital literacy and convergence of services delivered at district/block level.
Bihar.eligibility: Women in rural areas; outreach is often through Panchayats, SHGs and local women leaders.
benefits: Linkage to government schemes and credit
Bihar.howToApply: Visit the nearest Mahila Shakti Kendra in your block or contact state WCD for information on enrollment.

Bihar.name: Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana - NRLM (Women SHG support in Bihar)
Bihar.department: Ministry of Rural Development / Bihar State Rural Livelihoods
Bihar.description: Supports formation and strengthening of women Self Help Groups (SHGs), financial inclusion, micro-credit and livelihoods for women in rural Bihar.

benefits: Support for small enterprises and market linkages

Bihar.name: PM-KISAN (Central) - Bihar Implementation
Bihar.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare / Bihar Implementation
Bihar.description: Direct income support to small and marginal farmers in Bihar. Women farmers who meet eligibility are included in beneficiary lists and receive direct transfers.

benefits: Direct cash transfer to eligible farmer families
Bihar.howToApply: Register through the PM-KISAN portal or through the Bihar agriculture department/farmer facilitation centres.

Bihar.name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) - Bihar
Bihar.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare / State Agriculture
Bihar.description: Crop insurance scheme implemented in Bihar to protect farmers (including women farmers) against crop losses due to natural calamities and pests.
Bihar.eligibility: Farmers enrolled for notified crops and seasons under PMFBY scheme as implemented by Bihar state insurance arrangements.
Bihar.howToApply: Enroll through the state agriculture department or designated insurance service providers during the enrolment window.

Bihar.name: Ayushman Bharat - PM-JAY (Bihar)
Bihar.department: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare / State Health Agency, Bihar
Bihar.description: Health insurance coverage for vulnerable families in Bihar, covering secondary and tertiary care; serves pregnant women and families needing inpatient care.

benefits: Coverage up to the specified limit per family
Bihar.howToApply: Check eligibility on PM-JAY portal or contact the Bihar State Health Agency / district health office for enrolment and empanelled hospitals.

Bihar.name: National Health Mission (NHM) Bihar
Bihar.department: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare / State NHM Bihar
Bihar.description: Implementation of NHM programmes in Bihar focusing on maternal and child health, immunisation, and strengthening primary healthcare services.

Bihar.howToApply: Visit local PHC/CHC or Anganwadi; check state NHM portal for programme-specific grievance and enrolment details.

Bihar.name: Central Scholarships for Transgender Students (SMILE/MSJE)
Bihar.description: Scholarships and education support for transgender students eligible under central schemes administered via MSJE/SMILE and National Scholarship Portal.
Bihar.eligibility: Transgender students meeting eligibility criteria for central scholarships and state-level nomination where required.
benefits: Monetary scholarships for tuition and maintenance
Bihar.howToApply: Apply through National Scholarship Portal or MSJE/SMILE designated portals when calls are open; district social welfare offices help with applications.

Bihar.name: SMILE - Comprehensive Rehabilitation for Welfare of Transgender Persons (Central) - Bihar implementation
Bihar.department: Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment / State Social Welfare
Bihar.description: Central SMILE scheme components implemented in Bihar providing rehabilitation, skill training, scholarships and shelter support (Garima-Grih) for transgender persons.

Chhattisgarh.name: Chhattisgarh Mahila Kisan Sahayata

Chhattisgarh.description: Support measures for women farmers including input subsidies, women-only training sessions, promotion of women FPOs and access to credit and market linkages.

benefits: Training in improved agritech and value-addition
Access to credit & market linkages via FPOs/SHGs

Chhattisgarh.name: Chhattisgarh Transgender Inclusion & Livelihood Programme

Chhattisgarh.description: State-level interventions for social inclusion, skill development, livelihood support and access to social protection for transgender persons in Chhattisgarh.

Haryana.name: PM-KISAN (applicable in Haryana)
Haryana.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare / Haryana Agriculture
Haryana.description: Central income support to farmers; Haryana implements enrolment and direct benefit transfers for eligible families (including women joint-holders where applicable).
Haryana.eligibility: Small and marginal farmers as per PM-KISAN rules and state beneficiary lists.
Haryana.howToApply: Register via state agriculture portal / CSC; ensure Aadhaar-bank linkage and follow district-level enrolment drives.

Haryana.name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) ‚Äî Haryana
Haryana.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare / State Implementing Agency
Haryana.description: Central crop insurance scheme implemented in Haryana to provide compensation to farmers for crop losses due to natural calamities, pests and disease.
Haryana.eligibility: Farmers enrolled for notified crops and seasons under PMFBY.
Haryana.howToApply: Enroll through state agriculture notification windows, insurance agencies or CSC centres during enrolment periods.

Haryana.name: Kisan Credit Card (KCC) ‚Äî Haryana drives
Haryana.department: Banks / Haryana Agriculture Department
Haryana.description: Low-cost credit for farmers; Haryana periodically runs special enrolment drives to include women farmers as primary applicants or joint holders.
Haryana.eligibility: Farmers with land records or tenant farmers as per bank/state rules.
Haryana.howToApply: Apply at participating banks with land records and KYC; state agri offices may organise camps for KCC issuance.

Haryana.name: Mahila Kisan Sashaktikaran (Central/state implementation) ‚Äî Haryana focus
Haryana.department: Ministry of Women and Child Development / State Agencies
Haryana.description: Programmes to strengthen women farmers via training, access to inputs and credit, and special loan/subsidy windows for women-led agri-projects.
Haryana.eligibility: Women engaged in agriculture and allied activities; SHG-linked women projects encouraged.
benefits: Access to loans and seed grants
Priority under RKVY and state schemes
Haryana.howToApply: Apply via local WCD/agriculture offices or SHG federations; monitor state calls for women-led projects.

Haryana.name: Soil Health Card / Soil Health Program (Haryana)
Haryana.department: Department of Agriculture & Soil Health Cell
Haryana.description: State implementation of soil testing and SHC issuance to help farmers optimize input use; benefits extend to all farmers including women and transgender farmers.
Haryana.eligibility: All farmers may avail soil testing services as per state programme schedules.
Haryana.howToApply: Submit soil samples at designated testing labs or through agriculture extension officers; check state schedule for sample collection drives.

Haryana.name: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana (RKVY) / State Component (Haryana)
Haryana.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare / Haryana
Haryana.description: Central/state funds for agriculture development projects; Haryana may prioritise women-led projects and micro-irrigation, horticulture, and value addition components.
Haryana.eligibility: Project proposals from farmer groups, SHGs, and state agri bodies as per RKVY guidelines.
benefits: Subsidies for micro-irrigation and value addition
Haryana.howToApply: Submit proposals through state agriculture / RKVY desk during project calls; SHGs and farmer groups can apply via district offices.

Haryana.name: Haryana State Merit Scholarships & Post-Matric Scholarships (Women)
Haryana.department: Department of School Education & Haryana DBT / Social Welfare
Haryana.description: State scholarships and post-matric support for meritorious and needy girl students including hostel support and stipends administered via Haryana's DBT systems.
Haryana.eligibility: Girl students meeting merit/income criteria and Haryana residency requirements.
Haryana.howToApply: Apply through the state scholarship portal or college/university offices; follow DBT enrollment steps.

Haryana.name: Haryana Education Loan / Interest Subsidy (Women Development Schemes)
Haryana.department: Haryana Women and Child Development / State Finance Agencies
Haryana.description: State-supported education loan facilitation or interest subsidy schemes aimed at female students from economically weaker backgrounds to pursue higher education.
Haryana.eligibility: Female students from Haryana meeting income and admission criteria for higher studies.
Haryana.howToApply: Approach designated banks with state nodal agency endorsement or apply via the WCD/state loan portals when available.

Haryana.name: Aapki Beti Hamari Beti (Haryana) ‚Äî Girl Child Support
Haryana.department: Haryana Women & Child Development
Haryana.description: State initiative to promote girl child welfare through savings schemes, insurance and incentives for education and health.
Haryana.eligibility: Girls born to Haryana residents and registered under the scheme; details per state notification.
Haryana.howToApply: Register at the local WCD office or online via the state portal when available.

Haryana.name: Hostel & Scholarship Schemes for Girls (Haryana)
Haryana.department: Haryana Higher Education / Social Welfare
Haryana.description: State-run hostel accommodation and scholarship support for disadvantaged girl students to enable continued education away from home.
Haryana.eligibility: Girl students from Haryana meeting income/residence and academic criteria.
Haryana.howToApply: Apply via the college/university hostel office or state higher education portals during calls.

Haryana.name: Central Scholarships & NSP / SMILE (Transgender Education Support)
Haryana.department: Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment / National Scholarship Portal
Haryana.description: Central scholarships available through NSP and SMILE for transgender students; Haryana students can apply via national portals and state convergence programmes.
Haryana.eligibility: Transgender students meeting scholarship criteria under central schemes.
Haryana.howToApply: Apply through the National Scholarship Portal (NSP) or MSJE/SMILE scholarship portals when notified.

Haryana.name: PMMVY & JSY (Implemented in Haryana)
Haryana.department: Ministry of Women & Child Development / Ministry of Health & Family Welfare / Haryana Health Dept
Haryana.description: Central maternity benefit schemes (PMMVY / JSY) are implemented in Haryana to provide conditional cash transfers and support for institutional deliveries and maternal care.
Haryana.eligibility: Pregnant and lactating women enrolled at public health facilities as per scheme guidelines.
Haryana.howToApply: Register at public health facilities, Anganwadi centres or via ASHA/ANM workers for entitlements.

Haryana.name: Haryana Maternal & Child Health Programmes
Haryana.department: Haryana Health & Family Welfare
Haryana.description: State maternal and child health interventions (ANC, immunisation, nutrition, health camps) to improve maternal outcomes across districts in Haryana.
Haryana.eligibility: Pregnant and lactating women and children as per state NHM guidelines.
Haryana.howToApply: Register at PHCs, Anganwadis or district health offices; ASHAs/ANMs facilitate enrolment.

Haryana.name: Ayushman Bharat (PM-JAY) ‚Äî Haryana implementation
Haryana.department: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare / Haryana Health Dept
Haryana.description: National health protection scheme providing hospitalisation cover to eligible families in Haryana through empanelled hospitals.
Haryana.eligibility: Eligible families identified via SECC/state lists and PM-JAY rules.
Haryana.howToApply: Check PM-JAY portal or approach empanelled hospitals/state health offices for registration and authorisation.

Haryana.name: SMILE (Health & Livelihood components for Transgender) ‚Äî Haryana access
Haryana.department: Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment / State Social Welfare
Haryana.description: Central SMILE components providing skill training, shelter (Garima-Grih) referrals, scholarships and health support for transgender persons that are accessible in Haryana through state implementing agencies.
Haryana.eligibility: Self-identified transgender persons eligible for SMILE components as per guidelines.
Haryana.howToApply: Contact State Social Welfare Department or MSJE implementing agencies and NGOs for enrolment and referrals.

Haryana.name: Haryana Transgender Welfare Board & Notifications
Haryana.department: Haryana Social Justice / Welfare Department
Haryana.description: State-level board, rules and notifications establishing entitlements, welfare supports and operational procedures for transgender persons in Haryana (including welfare pensions and scheme convergence).
Haryana.eligibility: Transgender persons as per state rules and board registrations.
Haryana.howToApply: Approach the Transgender Welfare Board secretariat or Social Welfare Department for registration and benefit access.

Haryana.name: Free Legal Aid (NALSA framework via Haryana SLSA/DLSA)
Haryana.department: State Legal Services Authority / Department of Justice
Haryana.description: Free legal aid and assistance available to marginalized groups including transgender persons through the State Legal Services Authority and District Legal Services Authorities in Haryana.
Haryana.eligibility: Persons eligible under Legal Services Authorities Act; transgender and women survivors can access legal aid services.
benefits: Support for identity and discrimination cases
Haryana.howToApply: Approach the Haryana SLSA / DLSA office or use legal aid camps and NALSA contacts for assistance.

Haryana.name: Mahila Shakti Kendra / Mahila e-Haat linkages (Haryana)
Haryana.department: Ministry of Women & Child Development / Haryana WCD
Haryana.description: State implementation and linkages for Mahila Shakti Kendra and Mahila e-Haat to support women entrepreneurs in Haryana with market access and skilling.
Haryana.eligibility: Women entrepreneurs, SHG members and aspiring micro-entrepreneurs from Haryana.
benefits: Linkages to microcredit and digital platforms
Haryana.howToApply: Register with local Mahila Shakti Kendra or the Mahila e-Haat portal; contact WCD district office.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Himachal Pradesh Mahila Kisan Sahay (Women Farmer Support)
Himachal Pradesh.description: State programme providing training, input subsidies and dedicated extension support for women farmers to increase farm productivity and market linkages.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Women farmers who are residents of Himachal Pradesh and have landholding or are engaged in allied activities as per state records.
benefits: Priority access to state agriculture extension programmes
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Register at the nearest Krishi Vigyan Kendra (KVK) or district agriculture office; some components available through the state agriculture portal.
documentsRequired: Land record or proof of farming activity

Himachal Pradesh.name: Himachal Horticulture & High-Value Crop Support (Women Farmers)
Himachal Pradesh.description: Subsidies and technical assistance for women cultivating horticulture and high-value crops (fruits, floriculture, medicinal plants) with incentives for organic and terrace farming.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Women cultivators and SHG groups engaged in horticulture in HP.
benefits: Subsidy on planting material and polyhouses
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Apply through District Horticulture Offices or KVKs; SHG proposals may be routed via DWCD linkages.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Himachal Pradesh Transgender Agricultural Inclusion Programme
Himachal Pradesh.department: Himachal Pradesh Social Justice & Agriculture Departments (joint)
Himachal Pradesh.description: State initiative to provide skill training, small grants and input support to transgender persons who take up kitchen gardening, allied farming or homestead horticulture.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Self-identified transgender residents of Himachal Pradesh willing to participate in training and livelihood activities.
benefits: Skill training in horticulture and allied activities
Linkages to local markets and MGNREGA work where applicable
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Register at the District Social Welfare Office or State Transgender Cell; partner NGOs facilitate on-ground enrolment.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) - HP
Himachal Pradesh.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare / HP Department of Agriculture
Himachal Pradesh.description: Central direct income support to farmers; Himachal Pradesh manages beneficiary identification and transfers through state mechanisms. Women landholders and women farmers are eligible where land records indicate ownership or beneficiary status.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Small and marginal farmers as per PM-KISAN / state land records.
benefits: Direct cash transfer in instalments to eligible farmer families
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Register via state agriculture portals or through Common Service Centres; check HP PM-KISAN district nodal offices.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) - HP
Himachal Pradesh.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare / HP Agriculture Insurance
Himachal Pradesh.description: Central crop insurance scheme implemented in HP; benefits include compensation for crop losses. Special outreach for women farmers and tenant cultivators is conducted by state departments.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Farmers growing notified crops and enrolled for the season.
benefits: Stabilisation of farm income after disaster
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Enroll at notified insurance providers or state enrolment centres during notified windows.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Kisan Credit Card (KCC) - HP Women Outreach
Himachal Pradesh.description: Targeted KCC camps and simplified application support for women farmers and SHG members to access agricultural credit at concessional rates.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Farmers, including women and SHG members, meeting bank criteria.
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Apply at participating banks during KCC drives or through bank branches with land/identity documents.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Girl Child Scholarship
Himachal Pradesh.description: State merit and need-based scholarships targeted at girl students to support secondary and higher education and reduce dropout rates.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Girl students from Himachal Pradesh meeting academic and income criteria as per state scholarship rules.
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Apply through the HP education department scholarship portal or district education offices; school/college endorsement may be required.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Himachal Pradesh Girls Hostel & Boarding Support
Himachal Pradesh.department: Himachal Pradesh Women & Child Development / Education
Himachal Pradesh.description: State-run and state-funded hostel facilities and boarding support for girls from remote areas to facilitate secondary and higher education access.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Girls from specified remote or economically disadvantaged areas enrolled in recognised institutions.
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Apply through district education/education welfare offices or via college admission portals where hostels are attached.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Himachal Pradesh Transgender Education Support
Himachal Pradesh.department: Himachal Pradesh Social Justice & Education Departments
Himachal Pradesh.description: State-level scholarships, fee waivers and training grants to support transgender students in school, vocational training and higher education.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Self-identified transgender students resident in HP and meeting academic criteria for the support programme.
benefits: Support for vocational training and placement
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Register at the State Social Justice Department or apply via district education scholarship portals when calls are open.

Himachal Pradesh.name: National Scholarship Portal (NSP) - HP Students
Himachal Pradesh.description: Centralized portal to apply for various scholarships offered by central and state governments; HP students (including girls and transgender applicants) can apply via NSP.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Depends on specific scholarship; generally based on income and academic criteria.
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Register and apply via https://scholarships.gov.in/; contact HP nodal scholarship office for state-level assistance.

Himachal Pradesh.name: PMKVY - Skill & Training (HP outreach for Women & Transgender)
Himachal Pradesh.department: Ministry of Skill Development & Entrepreneurship / HP Skill Development Mission
Himachal Pradesh.description: Central skill training programmes implemented via state training partners; HP runs targeted PMKVY drives for women and transgender candidates to link them to local industry and tourism-related jobs.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Youth and candidates meeting course-specific criteria; special outreach for women and transgender persons.
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Register on the PMKVY portal or contact HP Skill Development Mission centres.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Himachal Pradesh Maternal & Child Health Initiative (NHM components)
Himachal Pradesh.description: State-specific components of NHM delivering maternal and child healthcare, antenatal care, institutional delivery support and nutrition services; special outreach to remote tribal/hill communities.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Pregnant women, lactating mothers and children as per NHM guidelines.
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Register at nearest public health centre or Anganwadi; ASHA workers assist with enrollment and referral.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Himachal Pradesh Transgender Health & Counselling Cells
Himachal Pradesh.department: Himachal Pradesh Health & Social Justice Departments
Himachal Pradesh.description: Designated health and counselling cells in district hospitals and select PHCs offering sexual and reproductive healthcare, mental health counselling and referral services tailored for transgender persons.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Transgender residents of HP seeking health or counselling services.
benefits: Linkages to HIV/TB and other public health programmes
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Approach the district hospital's transgender cell or contact the state social justice department for referral pathways.
documentsRequired: Aadhaar or other ID if available

Himachal Pradesh.name: Ayushman Bharat - PM-JAY (Himachal Pradesh Implementation)
Himachal Pradesh.department: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare / HP Health Department
Himachal Pradesh.description: Central health insurance scheme implemented in HP to provide cashless tertiary and secondary care cover to eligible families; state nodal agency handles enrolment and empanelment.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Eligible families as per state SECC and PM-JAY lists.
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Check eligibility on the PM-JAY portal and contact HP nodal PM-JAY office for assistance.

Himachal Pradesh.name: Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY) - Himachal Pradesh
Himachal Pradesh.department: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare / HP Health Department
Himachal Pradesh.description: Central scheme promoting institutional deliveries with conditional cash transfers; implemented via HP health facilities with ASHA and ANM support.
Himachal Pradesh.eligibility: Pregnant women meeting JSY criteria for institutional delivery.
Himachal Pradesh.howToApply: Register at the health facility or via ASHA/ANM; district health offices process JSY claims.

Jharkhand.name: Birsa Harit Gram Yojana (Women-focused)
Jharkhand.description: Empowers women in rural areas by providing training, saplings, and market access for sustainable farming. Success stories include transformation of barren land into productive orchards.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Women farmers, SHG groups and women-led farm enterprises in Jharkhand.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Contact the District Agriculture / Horticulture Office or local KVK; apply via state agriculture portal where available.
documentsRequired: Group registration for SHGs where applicable

Jharkhand.name: MGNREGS (State Implementation) - Women Participation
Jharkhand.department: Ministry of Rural Development / Jharkhand Rural Development
Jharkhand.description: Provides wage employment opportunities and asset-creation work; widely used by rural women to supplement income and participate in agriculture-related infrastructure works.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Rural households registered under MGNREGA; adult members available for manual work.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Register at the Gram Panchayat; apply for work through local panchayat offices or job card system.

Jharkhand.name: Jharkhand State Livelihood Promotion Society (JSLPS) - Women SHG Support
Jharkhand.description: Facilitates formation of Self-Help Groups (SHGs), provides training, microfinance linkages and support for women-led micro-enterprises.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Women interested in joining or forming SHGs and participating in livelihood activities.
benefits: Market access and business development support
Jharkhand.howToApply: Contact JSLPS district offices, block-level federation or local community organisers.

Jharkhand.name: Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs) - Women Inclusion
Jharkhand.department: Department of Agriculture / Jharkhand Farmers' Support
Jharkhand.description: Supports establishment and scaling of FPOs with focused membership drives to include women farmers so they can collectively market produce and improve bargaining power.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Groups of farmers (including women-only groups) forming or joining FPOs in Jharkhand.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Register as an FPO via the state agriculture department or through supported incubators and NGOs.

Jharkhand.name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) - Beneficiaries in Jharkhand
Jharkhand.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare / Jharkhand Agriculture
Jharkhand.description: Direct income support to eligible farmers; women landholders and women farmers are eligible where land records indicate ownership or beneficiary status.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Small and marginal farmers as defined by PM-KISAN and state records.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Register on the PM-KISAN portal or through state nodal offices and CSCs.

Jharkhand.name: National Mission on Sustainable Agriculture (NMSA) - Jharkhand Components
Jharkhand.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare / State Agriculture
Jharkhand.description: Promotes sustainable agricultural practices including organic farming, water conservation and climate-resilient techniques benefiting women farmers.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Farmers and groups participating in sustainable agriculture interventions.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Contact state NMSA nodal offices or District Agriculture/KVK for participation details.

Jharkhand.name: National Food Security Mission (NFSM) - Jharkhand
Jharkhand.department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare / State Agriculture
Jharkhand.description: Aims to increase the production of rice, wheat and other staples; benefits women engaged in cultivation and allied activities.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Farmers growing notified crops under NFSM components.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Contact district agriculture offices or KVKs for NFSM participation windows.

Jharkhand.name: Mukhymantri Sarthi Yojna (MSY) - Skill & Support for Girls and Transgender
Jharkhand.department: Jharkhand Department of Social Welfare / Skill Development
Jharkhand.description: Provides financial assistance, allowances and transportation support to girls, disabled and transgender persons for skill development and employment via DBT.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Girls, transgender persons and disabled beneficiaries meeting scheme criteria.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Apply via the state MSY portal or district welfare offices when calls are announced.
documentsRequired: Proof of disability/transgender status where applicable

Jharkhand.name: Project Gyanodaya (Godda e-learning initiative)
Jharkhand.description: E-learning platform launched in Godda district to provide online education and digital classrooms to improve access for girls and marginalized students.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Students enrolled in participating government schools and community learning centres.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Contact the district education office or school administration to participate in the programme.

Jharkhand.name: Renovation & Development of Women's Colleges (Jharkhand)
Jharkhand.description: State funding to renovate infrastructure and upgrade facilities in women's colleges to promote higher education participation.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Accredited women's colleges and institutions nominated for renovation funding.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Colleges apply via the State Higher Education Department; calls for proposals are announced periodically.

Jharkhand.name: Beti Bachao Beti Padhao (BBBP) - Jharkhand
Jharkhand.department: Ministry of Women & Child Development / Jharkhand WCD
Jharkhand.description: Central campaign to improve child sex ratio and promote girls' education; state nodal agencies implement awareness and education drives.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Girls across communities in Jharkhand; programmes engage families and schools.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Participate via local schools and community outreach events run by the WCD and education department.
documentsRequired: Not typically required for awareness activities

Jharkhand.name: Scholarships for Transgender Students (Central/State)
Jharkhand.department: Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment / Jharkhand Social Welfare
Jharkhand.description: Financial assistance schemes to support transgender students in continuing education and reduce dropout rates.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Transgender students meeting academic and income criteria under central or state scholarship guidelines.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Apply via National Scholarship Portal or state scholarship portals when scholarship calls are announced.

Jharkhand.name: National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship Scheme (NMMSS) - Jharkhand
Jharkhand.description: Scholarships to meritorious students from economically weaker sections to encourage continuation of studies at the secondary level.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Students meeting income and merit criteria under NMMSS rules.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Apply through school/district nodal offices or as directed by the state education department.

Jharkhand.name: One Stop Centres (OSCs) - Jharkhand
Jharkhand.department: Ministry of Women & Child Development / State WCD
Jharkhand.description: Provide integrated services including shelter, medical and legal aid, police assistance and counselling to women survivors of violence under the Nirbhaya Fund.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Women survivors of violence seeking assistance.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Approach the nearest One Stop Centre or contact the State WCD helpline; police and health facilities may refer survivors.

Jharkhand.name: Food Nutrition Health and WASH (FNHW) Initiative - Jharkhand
Jharkhand.description: Engages millions of rural women in promoting health, sanitation and nutrition practices including nutrition gardens and peer counselling programmes.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Community women volunteers and beneficiaries targeted by state public health programmes.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Contact district health or WCD offices; community mobilisation is done via ASHA and Anganwadi networks.
documentsRequired: Not typically required for community participation

Jharkhand.name: Transgender Welfare Board - Jharkhand
Jharkhand.department: Jharkhand Social Welfare / State Transgender Cell
Jharkhand.description: State-level body to address the health, livelihood and social welfare needs of transgender persons including access to healthcare and psychosocial support.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Contact the State Social Welfare Department or designated district contact points.
documentsRequired: Aadhaar or identity documentation where available

Jharkhand.name: Ayushman Bharat - PM-JAY (Jharkhand Implementation)
Jharkhand.department: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare / State Health Department
Jharkhand.description: Provides health coverage for eligible families in Jharkhand, including transgender individuals, for secondary and tertiary care.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Eligible families as identified in state PM-JAY lists.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Check eligibility on the PM-JAY portal and contact the Jharkhand nodal PM-JAY office for assistance.

Jharkhand.name: National Health Mission (NHM) - Jharkhand
Jharkhand.department: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare / State NHM
Jharkhand.description: Provides maternal, newborn and child health services, immunisation and primary healthcare; state NHM components support women and vulnerable groups.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Residents covered by state NHM programmes.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Register at public health centres, Anganwadi centres or contact district NHM offices.

Jharkhand.name: Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) - Jharkhand
Jharkhand.department: Ministry of Women & Child Development / State ICDS
Jharkhand.description: Provides nutrition, early childhood care and maternal support via Anganwadi centres to improve child and maternal health outcomes.
Jharkhand.eligibility: Pregnant women, lactating mothers and children as per ICDS guidelines.
Jharkhand.howToApply: Register at the local Anganwadi centre or contact the state ICDS office.

Karnataka.name: Karnataka Mahila Samrudhi
Karnataka.description: Microfinance and self-help group support for women in Karnataka.
Karnataka.eligibility: Women residents of Karnataka; SHG membership may be required.
Karnataka.howToApply: Apply via state portal or district WCD offices.

Karnataka.name: Karnataka Transgender Welfare Program
Karnataka.description: Support services, training and welfare programmes for transgender persons in Karnataka.
Karnataka.howToApply: Contact Social Welfare Department or registered NGOs.

Karnataka.name: Vanastree Collective (Uttara Kannada)
Karnataka.description: Empowers women in Uttara Kannada by promoting sustainable farming, seed exchange and community-supported agriculture.
Karnataka.eligibility: Women farmers and women-led producer groups in Uttara Kannada.
Karnataka.howToApply: Get in touch with the Vanastree Collective or local district agriculture office for participation details.

Karnataka.name: KSWDC Micro Credit Scheme (SHG Loans)
Karnataka.description: Provides concessional / interest-free micro loans (approx. ‚Çπ1 lakh‚Äì‚Çπ2 lakh) to women‚Äôs SHGs for income-generating and agri-related activities, including small-scale processing and value-addition.
Karnataka.eligibility: Registered women Self-Help Groups and women entrepreneurs in Karnataka.
Karnataka.howToApply: Apply through KSWDC district offices or the state women development portal; SHG endorsement is typically required.

Karnataka.name: KSWDC Rehabilitation Support for Transgender Individuals
Karnataka.department: Karnataka State Women Development Corporation / Social Welfare
Karnataka.description: Financial and enterprise support (assistance package of ‚Çπ50,000: ‚Çπ25,000 loan + ‚Çπ25,000 subsidy) to transgender individuals for setting up self-employment ventures and small agri-processing units.
Karnataka.eligibility: Self-identified transgender residents of Karnataka seeking to start self-employment ventures.
Karnataka.howToApply: Register with the State Social Welfare Department or KSWDC; district Social Welfare/Backward Classes offices typically coordinate applications.

Karnataka.name: Coconut & Agri Processing Federation (Bengaluru Urban)
Karnataka.department: Coconut and Agri Processing Federation / Bengaluru Urban
Karnataka.description: A federation in Bengaluru Urban that supports women and transgender entrepreneurs in coconut and agri-processing through training, common processing facilities and market linkages.
Karnataka.eligibility: Women and transgender individuals involved in coconut/agri-processing and allied products.
benefits: Access to processing units and equipment
Karnataka.howToApply: Contact the federation or district industry/agriculture office for enrolment and facility access details.

Karnataka.name: Deepika Student Scholarship Programme
Karnataka.department: Karnataka Higher Education / State Scholarship Cell
Karnataka.description: Provides up to ‚Çπ30,000 annually to eligible girls from government colleges pursuing higher education, supporting tuition and living expenses.
Karnataka.eligibility: Female students enrolled in government colleges who meet academic and income criteria.
benefits: Support for tuition and study materials
Karnataka.howToApply: Apply via the state scholarship portal or college scholarship cell when calls are open.

Karnataka.name: Chevening-Karnataka Scholarship (Women)
Karnataka.description: A state-supported nomination and preparatory assistance pathway that helps outstanding women candidates from Karnataka compete for fully funded Chevening scholarships to study a one-year master's abroad.
Karnataka.eligibility: Women meeting Chevening and state criteria for leadership and academic excellence.
benefits: Scholarship nomination guidance and preparatory help
